**Day 2 of the LinkedIn Clone Project** Yesterday, I kicked off my LinkedIn Clone Project to sharpen my full stack development skills. I started with the navigation bar component, making it responsive, though it's still a work in progress. Today, I began working on the home page, focusing on the profile and post card components. The feed section is next on the list. **Why I Started This Project** Despite my confidence in building web applications as a full stack developer, my skills haven't yet met the expectations of the companies I've applied to. After applying to almost 100 jobs and internships with no response, I decided to elevate my expertise. This LinkedIn project is my commitment to not just telling but showing my capabilities. By developing both the frontend and backend business logic, I'm ready to tackle any challenges that come my way and demonstrate my value to potential employers.
